name: Example Royal Commission
summary: This is a fictional example commission for demonstration purposes, investigating systemic issues in public administration and governance.
findings: The commission found several areas for improvement in policy and practice, including gaps in accountability, insufficient oversight mechanisms, and inadequate consultation processes. The report highlighted the need for greater transparency, improved service delivery, and enhanced community engagement.

categories.name: Governance and Accountability
categories.description: Recommendations for improving governance structures and accountability mechanisms

recommendations.recommendation: Establish a national anti-corruption commission with broad investigative powers and adequate resourcing to investigate allegations of corruption across all levels of government.
Implement mandatory transparency reporting for all government departments, including publication of decision-making processes and expenditure data.

categories.name: Public Services
categories.description: Recommendations for improving public service delivery and accessibility

recommendations.recommendation: Increase funding for mental health services by 50% over three years, with particular focus on rural and remote communities.
Establish standardized service delivery benchmarks across all government agencies to ensure consistent quality of public services.

categories.name: Policy Review
categories.description: Recommendations for reviewing and reforming existing policies

recommendations.recommendation: Review mandatory detention policies with a view to reducing their use and implementing alternative community-based solutions where appropriate.
recommendations.notes: Government rejected recommendation citing security concerns

ongoingChallenges: Resistance to policy review in certain areas
Coordination between different levels of government
Adequate resourcing for all recommended initiatives
